name: harvested
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
harvest
harvest verb
(CROPS)
[ T or I ] to pick and collect crops, or to collect plants, animals, or fish to eat: In the US, winter wheat is harvested in the early summer. Farmers sort the vegetables when they harvest.

harvest verb
(BODY PARTS)
[ T ] to take cells or other body parts from someone for medical use: The donor organ is harvested at the accident scene and rushed to a hospital. Stem cells harvested from cord blood have been used to successfully treat dozens of serious illnesses.

Cells
Medical treatment: surgery
harvest verb
(INFORMATION)
[ T ] to collect large quantities of information, especially automatically: The ministry will not harvest data about salaries, sexual orientation, or country of origin for foreigners. Unauthorized use of personal information harvested from social networks is likely to anger potential customers.
